actor_awards.military_honors: Bronze Star with Combat 'V' (Battle of Tarawa)

filmography.title: Brother Rat
filmography.role_description: A star pitcher at the Virginia Military Institute who struggles to balance baseball, academics, and a secret marriage.
filmography.plot: Three cadets at the Virginia Military Institute try to get out of trouble before the big baseball game.

filmography.title: On Your Toes
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville hoofer who tries to leave the family business to become a classical music composer.
filmography.plot: A vaudevillian turns composer and gets mixed up with a Russian ballet company and a jealous prima donna.

filmography.title: Four Wives
filmography.role_description: A gentle doctor who marries one of the Lemp sisters in this sequel to 'Four Daughters'.
filmography.plot: The four Lemp sisters navigate marriage and motherhood, with one sister facing widowhood and a new romance.

filmography.title: The Wagons Roll at Night
filmography.role_description: A greenhorn grocery clerk who is recruited by a carnival owner (Humphrey Bogart) to become a lion tamer.
filmography.plot: A circus owner hires a young man to tame lions, but trouble starts when the new hire falls for the owner's sister.

filmography.title: Eagle Squadron
filmography.role_description: An American pilot who joins the RAF to fight the Germans before the U.S. officially enters the war.
filmography.plot: American pilots join the Royal Air Force during the Battle of Britain to fight against the Luftwaffe.

filmography.title: Bombardier
filmography.role_description: A cocky bombardier cadet who clashes with his instructors while training for high-altitude precision bombing.
filmography.plot: The head of the bombardier training school struggles to prove the value of the bombsight while training a new class of cadets.

filmography.title: Smash-Up, the Story of a Woman
filmography.role_description: A successful songwriter whose rise to fame inadvertently contributes to his wife's descent into alcoholism.
filmography.plot: A singer sacrifices her career for her songwriter husband, but his success leads her to depression and the bottle.

filmography.title: You're in the Navy Now
filmography.role_description: A naval officer struggling to command a crew on a ship with an experimental steam engine.
filmography.plot: A green naval officer is assigned to command a ship with a steam engine that the crew can't figure out how to operate.

filmography.title: Carrie
filmography.role_description: A smooth-talking traveling salesman who seduces the title character and brings her to Chicago.
filmography.plot: A young woman moves to the big city where she begins an affair with a married man that leads to his ruin.

filmography.title: Roman Holiday
filmography.role_description: A carefree photographer who helps his reporter friend hide a princess's identity to get a scoop; earned Albert his first Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA: Nomination – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Oklahoma!
filmography.role_description: A Persian peddler who unwillingly gets engaged to Ado Annie in this classic musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: In the Oklahoma territory, a farm girl is courted by a cowboy and a menacing farmhand.

filmography.title: I'll Cry Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: An Alcoholics Anonymous sponsor who helps singer Lillian Roth find sobriety and love.
filmography.plot: The true story of singer Lillian Roth, whose stardom is destroyed by sixteen years of alcoholism before she finds redemption.

filmography.title: The Teahouse of the August Moon
filmography.role_description: An army psychiatrist who is more interested in agriculture and organic farming than psychology.
filmography.plot: An American captain is sent to an Okinawan village to teach democracy, but the culture and the interpreter change him instead.

filmography.title: Attack
filmography.role_description: A cowardly and incompetent company commander whose failures cost the lives of his men during the Battle of the Bulge.
filmography.plot: A coward captain is the only authority in a unit that is about to undertake a dangerous mission.

filmography.title: The Sun Also Rises
filmography.role_description: A heavy-drinking war veteran and writer, serving as the loyal best friend to the protagonist in 1920s Europe.
filmography.plot: A group of disillusioned American expatriate writers live a dissolute, hedonistic lifestyle in France and Spain in the 1920s.

filmography.title: The Joker Is Wild
filmography.role_description: The devoted accompanist and friend to comedian Joe E. Lewis, who sticks by him through his battles with the mob and alcoholism.
filmography.plot: The story of Joe E. Lewis, a singer who refused to kowtow to the mob, survived a brutal attack, and returned to show business as a comedian.

filmography.title: The Gun Runners
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, ruthless arms dealer who forces a charter boat captain to smuggle guns to Cuban revolutionaries.
filmography.plot: A boat owner facing financial ruin is hired by a gunrunner to transport weapons to Cuba.
filmography.awards: Based on 'To Have and Have Not'

filmography.title: The Roots of Heaven
filmography.role_description: A cynical American photographer who joins an eco-crusader in Africa to protect elephants from poachers.
filmography.plot: An idealist in French Equatorial Africa launches a one-man campaign to save the elephants from extinction.

filmography.title: Beloved Infidel
filmography.role_description: A close friend and confidant to Sheilah Graham during her tumultuous relationship with F. Scott Fitzgerald.
filmography.plot: The story of the romance between columnist Sheilah Graham and author F. Scott Fitzgerald during his final years in Hollywood.

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: A U.S. Army Colonel who leads his troops onto Omaha Beach during the D-Day invasion.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

filmography.title: Captain Newman, M.D.
filmography.role_description: A disturbed military officer dealing with the psychological toll of sending men to their deaths.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a captain in the Medical Corps runs the psychiatric ward of an Army Air Corps hospital.

filmography.title: The Heartbreak Kid
filmography.role_description: The hostile, protective father of a young woman pursued by a newlywed man; earned Albert his second Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: A newlywed man falls in love with another woman on his honeymoon and decides to pursue her, despite her father's objections.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; National Society of Film Critics: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Longest Yard
filmography.role_description: The ruthless, manipulative prison warden who forces inmates to play a football game against the guards.
filmography.plot: A sadistic warden asks a former pro quarterback, now serving time in his prison, to put together a team of inmates to take on (and get pummeled by) the guards.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy) (Burt Reynolds)

filmography.title: McQ
filmography.role_description: A police captain who clashes with a rogue detective (John Wayne) investigating the murder of his partner.
filmography.plot: A police lieutenant resigns from the force to hunt down the gangsters who killed his partner.

filmography.title: Escape to Witch Mountain
filmography.role_description: A grumpy widower traveling in a camper who reluctantly helps two alien children escape a millionaire who wants their powers.
filmography.plot: Two mysterious orphan children have extraordinary powers and are chased by a scheming millionaire. But where do these kids really call home?

filmography.title: Hustle
filmography.role_description: A corrupt, powerful lawyer involved in a cover-up surrounding the death of a young woman.
filmography.plot: A police detective and a call girl get involved in a complex case involving the death of a young woman.

filmography.title: Dreamscape
filmography.role_description: The U.S. President who is plagued by nightmares of nuclear war and seeks help from a psychic researcher.
filmography.plot: A young psychic on the run from himself is recruited by a government agency experimenting with the use of dream-sharing technology.
